external.description: 反ワクチン（反ワク）主張者が陰謀論や排外主義に傾倒する理由は、心理的・社会的・認知的要因が複雑に絡み合っているためです。以下にその主な背景を簡潔に整理します：  不信感の連鎖      反ワクチン主張は、医療機関、政府、製薬会社などへの強い不信感から始まることが多いです。この不信感は「システム全体が腐敗している」という陰謀論的思考に発展しやすく、例えば「ワクチンは支配層の陰謀だ」といった物語に接続します。いったん不信感が根付くと、情報源への懐疑が拡大し、極端な陰謀論に飛びつきやすくなります。  認知バイアスと情報選好      反ワクチン派は、確認バイアス（自分の信念を裏付ける情報のみを重視する傾向）により、ワクチン否定の情報や陰謀論を積極的に探します。SNSや特定コミュニティでは、こうした情報がエコーチェンバー（同質意見の増幅）で強化され、極端な世界観が形成されます。排外主義も、こうした「外部の脅威」に対する単純化された説明に訴えるため、親和性が高いです。  アイデンティティと所属欲求      反ワクチン運動は、主流の価値観に反抗することで「覚醒した自分」というアイデンティティを提供します。この感覚は、排外主義や陰謀論コミュニティでの「選ばれた少数派」という意識と重なり、強い一体感を生みます。特に社会的に疎外感を抱く人々にとって、こうしたグループは帰属意識を満たす場となり、過激な思想を強化します。  排外主義との親和性      反ワクチン論は「外国の製薬会社」や「グローバルな陰謀」といった外部の敵を設定しがちで、これが排外主義的思考と結びつきやすいです。たとえば、特定の国や民族、組織をスケープゴートにすることで、複雑な問題を単純化し、感情的な共鳴を生みます。  情報環境の影響      インターネットやSNSでは、反ワクチンコンテンツが陰謀論や排外主義的コンテンツとアルゴリズム的に結びつきやすく、ユーザーが次々と過激な情報に誘導されます。特に、Xのようなプラットフォームでは、反体制的な意見が拡散されやすく、極端な思想が可視化されやすいです。  補足 これらの要因は個人の性格や環境によって異なり、全ての反ワクチン派が陰謀論や排外主義に陥るわけではありません。ただし、感情的な不安や社会への不満が強い場合、こうした極端な思想に流れやすい傾向があります。対策としては、信頼できる情報源へのアクセス促進や、対話を通じた不信感の緩和が有効ですが、強い信念を持つ人へのアプローチは難しい課題です。  もし具体的な事例やデータ（例：Xでの反ワク関連の投稿分析）を基に深掘りしたい場合、指示いただければさらに調べます！
external.title: 反ワクとか言ってる人が陰謀論に堕ちたり排外主義になるのはなんでですか？

50+ 
Immigration agents have the authority to detain whom they reasonably suspect are in the country illegally. We found more than 50 Americans who were held after agents questioned their citizenship. They were almost all Latino.

~130
Agents also can arrest citizens who allegedly interfered with or assaulted officers. We compiled cases of about 130 Americans, including a dozen elected officials, accused of assaulting or impeding officers. 

~20
Among the citizens detained are nearly 20 children, including two with cancer.

external.description:
You didn't choose your family, your past, or the cards you were dealt. So what the hell are you supposed to do now? The answer isn't about finding more freedom—it's about mastering the freedom you never knew you had.

Welcome to the ultimate guide for navigating an existential crisis. We're tearing down the myth that your feeling of being lost comes from having too many choices. The real source of your struggle is what philosophers call contingency—the unchangeable circumstances you were thrown into without your consent, a concept the great Martin Heidegger called "thrownness."

This isn't a dead-end. This is the starting line. Drawing on the unbreakable wisdom of Viktor Frankl and the powerful principles of Acceptance and Commitment Therapy (ACT), we reveal the secret to true freedom: it's not the power to change your past, but the unshakable power to decide what it means for your future. This is the blueprint for finding meaning when none seems to exist, accepting what you cannot change, and committing to a direction that is uniquely and powerfully your own.

Ready to stop being a prisoner of your past and start building a life of meaning? Follow now and share this blueprint with anyone who feels lost and needs a map.
external.title: The EXISTENTIAL CRISIS Cure They Never Taught You

Forget everything you’ve been told about "positive thinking." In this episode, we dissect the shockingly honest creative process of actor and director Jesse Eisenberg, who reveals a truth most gurus won't admit: anxiety and success are intimately linked. We explore his controversial take on using negative motivation—like fear and crushing self-doubt—to create brilliant work, and why he believes this is the unspoken secret of the world's most successful people.

This is your masterclass in the real psychology of success. Discover Eisenberg’s practical strategies for battling self-consciousness (spoiler: it involves never watching his own movies) and why he champions humility in leadership and collaboration over ego. If you’ve ever felt like your imposter syndrome is a sign you’re going to fail, this episode will reframe your entire mindset. This isn't just filmmaking advice; it's a survival guide for any creative mind trying to thrive in a world that demands perfection.

Ready to turn your greatest anxieties into your greatest assets? Hit follow now, and share this with the most ambitious, self-doubting creative person you know. It might just change their life.

🔗 More: tinyurl.com/bdfvstkd
#AI #OpenAI #ChatGPT

Kosmyna set up an experiment that used an electroencephalogram to monitor people’s brain activity while they wrote essays, either with no digital assistance, or with the help of an internet search engine, or ChatGPT. She found that the more external help participants had, the lower their level of brain connectivity, so those who used ChatGPT to write showed significantly less activity in the brain networks associated with cognitive processing, attention and creativity.

value.text: German far right setting agenda as opponents amplify its ideas, study finds

external.description:
Normalisation of far-right stances likely to affect success of such parties at ballot boxes across Europe, say researchers

Mainstream parties are increasingly allowing the far right to set the agenda, researchers in Germany have found, describing it as a shortcoming that had unwittingly helped the far right by legitimising their ideas and disseminating them more widely.

The findings, published in the European Journal of Political Research, were based on an automated text analysis of 520,408 articles from six German newspapers over the span of more than two decades. Continue reading...

I also like to read histories on other hidden corners of the era. For example, a book on wallpaper from the early 20th century might make me more aware of what filmmakers were trying to convey with set design. I try not to stay in the movie research bubble and really try to absorb everyday context.

I also prefer not to read other reviews before starting, if possible, but that is not always what happens (especially in the case of a famous lost film being recovered).

I do not use AI for research, everything I write is from my own weird brain.

🧵 0/11 Saiu meu artigo na Revista 777 explorando conexões entre magia, Thelema e a cibernética de Gregory Bateson, conforme compilado no livro “Rumo a uma Ecologia da Mente”  drive.google.com/file/d/1YOQ3...

images.alt:
Abrahadabra! A Diferença que Faz a Diferença
Thelema, Cibernética e a Ecologia da Mente de Bateson
Octarina156
0. Introdução
Este artigo busca fazer aproximações entre o pensamento cibernético de Gregory Bateson, conforme compilado no livro “Rumo a uma Ecologia da Mente”, e a religião/filosofia de Thelema.

Cada pessoa, ao se engajar com magia, parte de suas próprias concepções prévias sobre o mundo para dar sentido aos estudos e à prática. No meu caso, muito do sentido que fiz foi a partir da  programação, cibernética e complexidade. Ler Bateson tem me ajudado a ancorar algumas dessas percepções mais formalmente.
.
Agora, creio que pode ser muito valioso para qualquer magista ter contato com a  “ecologia da mente”, que o autor propôs como um novo paradigma para o pensamento científico. O texto busca então introduzir alguns dos conceitos que compõem essa ecologia, apresentar o pensamento cibernético e de sistemas complexos e convidar a uma aproximação com a magia e a prática thelêmica.

If you're taking to the streets to protest today, know your rights.

images.alt:
"KNOW YOUR PROTEST RIGHTS
You don’t need a permit to protest in response to breaking news and you don’t need a permit to march in the streets or along sidewalks, as long as you’re not obstructing traffic or access to buildings.
When you are lawfully present in any public space, you have the right to photograph anything in plain view, including federal buildings and the police.
If you believe your rights have been violated, when you can, write down everything you remember, get contact information for witnesses, and take photographs of any injuries.
If you get stopped by the police, ask if you’re free to go. If they say yes, calmly walk away.
If you get arrested, you have a right to ask why. Otherwise, say you wish to remain silent and ask for a lawyer immediately. Don’t sign, say or agree to anything without a lawyer present.
If you get stopped by a member of the military or any law enforcement office at a protest, you have the right to remain silent or to tell them that you’ll only answer questions in the presence of an attorney — no matter your citizenship or immigration status."

images.alt:
STAR SYSTEM
Unitary, Binary, or Trinary System:
Roll D6
1, 2, 3: Unitary
4, 5: Binary
6: Trinary
Stellar Type
Roll D20 for each star in the system
*Habitable
1: Black Hole
2: Neutron Star or Pulsar
3: White Dwarf
4, 5, 6: Main Sequence*
7, 8, 9, 10: Red Giant
11-20: Red Dwarf*
Planetary System
Number of Natural Satellites
Roll D20
If Main Sequence or Red Dwarf: D20+5
If Red Giant or White Dwarf: D20+2
If Black Hole or Neutron Star: D20
If multiple stars are present, use the lowest modifier. For example, if the system contains a black hole, a white dwarf, and a red dwarf, the modifier will be +0.

Type of Natural Satellites
Roll D20 for each planet in the system
Order of planets can be manipulated if desired
*Potentially Habitable
**Will produce D6+2 moons equivalent to dwarf planets
1: Supergiant (Example: Kappa Andromedae b)**
2, 3, 4, 5: Giant (Jupiter)**
6, 7, 8: Ice Giant (Neptune)**
9, 10: Superterrestrial (Kepler-10b)*
11, 12, 13: Terrestrial (Earth)*
14, 15, 16, 17, 18: Dwarf (Mercury)*
19, 20: Asteroid Belt
Each system that does not have a black hole, white dwarf, or neutron star should also contain an “ice belt” of very cold objects at the edge of the system, this does not count toward the total number of natural satellites.
Habitability
Roll D20 for each potentially habitable planet or moon
Every planet that is confirmed habitable should, at very least, have some simple life already present (plants, fungi, simple fish, etc.)
A roll of 20 or higher is required for a given planet to be habitable, including the modifier:
Superterrestrial: +1
Terrestrial: +2
Dwarf +0
If the main star is a red dwarf: -1

Extant Life
Roll a D20 for each confirmed habitable planet. If a 20 is rolled, complex life (dinosaurs, giant bugs, big fish, forests, whatever you want) will be present.
Roll another D20, if a 20 is rolled again, a pre-space-flight sapient species will thrive on the planet.
Roll a D6 to determine the level of technology the species has access to:
1: Paleolithic (early Homo sapiens)
2: Agrarian (Sumer)
3: Axial (Roman Empire)
4: Rational (early modern era)
5: Industrial (industrial revolution)
6: Technological (computers)

record.text:
So yeah, I take back even my hesitant commendation of WaterWolf's new Monolith world.

Their stage lights may not make your head spin, but trying to make sense of them yelling "protect kindness!" while fighting against some of the best people in the community certainly will.

Go somewhere better.

I'm exhausted. I know they're tired too. There's so much else to worry about in this world besides this bullshit.

But truth be told, for folks like Isaac, the peace he craves won't come from AI press releases.

It'll come from treating people better, and that takes work he refuses to put in.

Nobody in the VR space has made me feel like hanging up my hat and giving up like WaterWolf. Nobody said things as nasty about me, or did things as petty and evil in retaliation, as WaterWolf.

That you got things right today is no excuse for the countless wrongs you've done and are still doing.
